intro: Bartlingia brachyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved barlingia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Bartlingia brachyphylla is adapted to grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to dry conditions.
